    I have a cough, what should I do?
output_parser.answer:
There are many possible causes of a cough, ranging from a common cold to more serious conditions such as pneumonia or bronchitis. In order to provide a more accurate diagnosis and treatment plan, I would need more information about your cough. For example, how long have you had the cough? Is it a dry cough or a productive cough? Are you experiencing any other symptoms such as fever, chest pain, or shortness of breath? 

Assuming that your cough is not severe and you are not experiencing any other symptoms, there are a few things you can do to help alleviate your cough. First, make sure you are staying hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids. You can also try using a humidifier or taking a hot shower to help loosen any mucus in your airways. Over-the-counter cough suppressants or expectorants may also be helpful in reducing your cough. 

However, if your cough persists or you begin to experience other symptoms, it is important to seek medical attention. Your healthcare provider can help determine the underlying cause of your cough and provide appropriate treatment. 

Do you have any other symptoms or concerns that you would like to discuss?
